title: Proof Pipeline Outage
fault_description: Kill the proof generation service process to simulate a complete pipeline outage. Verifies that pending proofs are queued (not dropped), circuit breaker activates, and the pipeline recovers after service restart.
fault_injection_steps: Record current proof pipeline health metrics and queue depth
Send SIGKILL to the proof generation service process
Verify proof pipeline reports unhealthy status
Record fault injection timestamp and initial queue depth
recovery_steps: Detect proof pipeline outage via health monitoring
Queue incoming proof requests (verify none are dropped)
Verify pipeline health check returns healthy
Drain queued proofs and verify processing
verification_steps: Confirm proof pipeline health metric is healthy
Validate proof generation latency returns to baseline
Verify queued proof backlog has been fully drained
Run end-to-end proof generation test with known input
Confirm no proof requests were dropped during outage
abort_conditions: Proof requests are being dropped instead of queued
Pipeline restart causes cascading failures in dependent services
Queue depth exceeds capacity, risking data loss
Recovery time exceeds 3x SLO with no progress
